item.title: Von add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Von add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Von add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Von add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Von add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Von add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Von add a quote by Stephen Chbosky
item.description: "We accept the love we think we deserve." -- Stephen Chbosky

item.title: Von add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Von add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Von add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Love is a better master than duty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Von add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Von add a quote by Anton Chekhov
item.description: "Any idiot can face a crisis; it's this day-to-day living that wears you out." -- Anton Chekhov

item.title: Von add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"Quand tu veux construire un bateau, ne commence pas par rassembler du bois, couper des planches et distribuer du travail, mais reveille au sein des hommes le desir de la mer grande et large.
If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Von add a quote by MIchael Chabon
item.description: "The truth of some promises is not as important as whether or not you can believe in them, with all your heart." -- MIchael Chabon

item.title: Von add a quote by I have no clue.
item.description: "The concept is Freedom, and it's action is choice" -- I have no clue.

item.title: Von add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act." -- George Orwell

item.title: Von add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper, That we may record our emptiness." -- Kahlil Gibran
